intro: Sleumeria auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate sleumeria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves with a distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) base. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. Sleumeria auriculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
